storyTitle: As Employee, I want to securely log in to access my schedule to protect my personal information

testCases.title: Validate successful login with valid credentials
preconditions: Employee has a valid registered account in the system
Employee knows their correct username and password
Application is accessible via HTTPS
UserCredentials database is available and operational
Employee is not currently logged in

steps.action: Employee opens a web browser and navigates to the application login page URL
steps.expectedResult: Login page loads successfully displaying username field, password field, and login button

steps.action: Employee enters valid username in the username field
steps.expectedResult: Username is accepted and displayed in the username field

steps.action: Employee enters valid password in the password field
steps.expectedResult: Password is masked and displayed as dots or asterisks in the password field

steps.action: Employee clicks the login button
steps.expectedResult: System validates credentials against UserCredentials database, authentication completes within 2 seconds, and employee is redirected to the home/dashboard page

steps.action: Employee navigates to the schedule page by clicking on schedule menu or link
steps.expectedResult: Schedule page loads successfully displaying the employee's schedule information with proper authentication session maintained

postconditions: Employee is successfully authenticated and logged in
Active session is created for the employee
Employee has access to schedule and other protected pages
Session token is stored securely
Login event is logged in the system

testCases.title: Verify rejection of invalid credentials
preconditions: Application is accessible via HTTPS
Login page is functional
UserCredentials database is available
Employee is not currently logged in

steps.action: Employee navigates to the login page
steps.expectedResult: Login page loads successfully with username and password fields displayed

steps.action: Employee enters an invalid username (non-existent user) in the username field
steps.expectedResult: Invalid username is accepted in the input field

steps.action: Employee enters any password in the password field
steps.expectedResult: Password is masked and displayed in the password field

steps.action: Employee clicks the login button
steps.expectedResult: System validates credentials, authentication fails, and error message 'Invalid credentials' is displayed on the login page within 2 seconds

steps.action: Employee attempts to directly access the schedule page URL by typing it in the browser address bar
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied, employee is redirected to the login page with message indicating authentication is required

steps.action: Employee enters a valid username but incorrect password and clicks login
steps.expectedResult: System validates credentials, authentication fails, and error message 'Invalid credentials' is displayed

postconditions: Employee remains unauthenticated
No session is created
Employee does not have access to protected pages
Failed login attempt is logged in the system
Employee remains on the login page

testCases.title: Ensure session termination on logout
preconditions: Employee is already logged in with valid credentials
Active session exists for the employee
Employee is on any page within the application
Logout button is visible and accessible

steps.action: Employee locates and clicks the logout button
steps.expectedResult: System processes logout request via POST /api/auth/logout endpoint, session is terminated within 2 seconds, and employee is redirected to the login page

steps.action: Employee verifies they are on the login page
steps.expectedResult: Login page is displayed with username and password fields, no user-specific information is visible

steps.action: Employee attempts to access the schedule page by typing the schedule URL directly in the browser address bar
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied, employee is redirected back to the login page with message indicating login is required

steps.action: Employee clicks the browser back button
steps.expectedResult: Employee remains on the login page or is redirected to login page, cannot access previously viewed authenticated pages

steps.action: Employee attempts to access any other protected page within the application
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied for all protected pages, employee is redirected to login page

postconditions: Employee session is completely terminated
Session token is invalidated
Employee cannot access any protected pages without re-authentication
Logout event is logged in the system
Employee is on the login page

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to log out securely to protect my schedule information

testCases.title: Validate successful logout and session termination
preconditions: Employee is logged in with valid credentials
Active session exists for the employee
Employee is on a schedule-related page
Logout button is visible on the current page

steps.action: Employee locates the logout button on the current page
steps.expectedResult: Logout button is visible and clearly labeled

steps.action: Employee clicks the logout button
steps.expectedResult: System sends POST request to /api/auth/logout endpoint, session is terminated, and employee is redirected to the login page within 2 seconds

steps.action: Employee verifies the current page is the login page
steps.expectedResult: Login page is displayed with username and password input fields, no authenticated user information is visible

steps.action: Employee attempts to navigate to the schedule page by entering the schedule page URL in the browser address bar
steps.expectedResult: Access to schedule page is denied, employee is immediately redirected to the login page

steps.action: Employee attempts to use the browser back button to return to the schedule page
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied, employee is redirected to the login page, previous session cannot be restored

steps.action: Employee attempts to access any other schedule-related page directly via URL
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied to all schedule-related pages, employee is redirected to login page with message indicating authentication is required

postconditions: Employee session is completely invalidated
All session tokens are destroyed
Employee cannot access any protected schedule pages
Employee is on the login page
Logout action is logged with timestamp
System maintains 100% logout success rate

testCases.title: Verify logout button accessibility
preconditions: Employee is logged in with valid credentials
Active session exists
Multiple schedule-related pages are available in the application
Employee has permission to access various schedule pages

steps.action: Employee navigates to the main schedule page
steps.expectedResult: Main schedule page loads successfully and logout button is visible in the navigation area or header

steps.action: Employee verifies the logout button is clickable on the main schedule page
steps.expectedResult: Logout button is enabled, properly styled, and responds to hover/focus events

steps.action: Employee navigates to the schedule details page or view schedule page
steps.expectedResult: Schedule details page loads successfully and logout button is visible in the same consistent location

steps.action: Employee verifies the logout button is clickable on the schedule details page
steps.expectedResult: Logout button is enabled and functional

steps.action: Employee navigates to any other schedule-related page (e.g., schedule settings, schedule history, or schedule preferences)
steps.expectedResult: Page loads successfully and logout button is visible in the consistent location across all pages

steps.action: Employee verifies the logout button is clickable on each additional schedule-related page
steps.expectedResult: Logout button is enabled, functional, and maintains consistent appearance and position across all schedule-related pages

steps.action: Employee clicks the logout button from any of the visited pages
steps.expectedResult: Logout functionality works correctly, session is terminated, and employee is redirected to login page within 2 seconds

postconditions: Logout button accessibility is confirmed on all schedule-related pages
Consistent user experience is validated across all pages
Employee is logged out successfully
Session is terminated
Employee is on the login page

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to receive error messages when schedule data is unavailable to understand issues

testCases.title: Validate error message display on data retrieval failure
preconditions: Employee is logged into the system with valid credentials
Employee has permission to access schedule data
Backend service is configured to simulate failure scenarios
Test environment is set up with error simulation capabilities

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule page as an employee
steps.expectedResult: Schedule page interface is displayed and attempts to load schedule data

steps.action: Simulate backend failure during schedule retrieval (trigger API error response)
steps.expectedResult: System detects the data retrieval failure within 1 second

steps.action: Observe the error message displayed on the screen
steps.expectedResult: Error message is displayed to employee clearly indicating schedule data is unavailable

steps.action: Read and verify the content of the error message
steps.expectedResult: Message is user-friendly, clear, and suggests next steps such as 'Please try again' or 'Contact support if the issue persists'

steps.action: Verify the error message appears within the specified time threshold
steps.expectedResult: Error message is displayed within 1 second of failure detection

steps.action: Check backend logs for error recording
steps.expectedResult: Error is logged in the backend system with appropriate details for diagnostics

postconditions: Error message is visible to the employee
Application remains stable and functional
Error is logged in the system for backend diagnostics
Employee can attempt to retry or contact support

testCases.title: Ensure system stability during data failures
preconditions: Employee is logged into the system
Schedule page is accessible
Backend service can be configured to fail on demand
System monitoring tools are active to detect crashes

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule page as an employee
steps.expectedResult: Schedule page loads and initiates data retrieval request

steps.action: Trigger schedule data retrieval failure by simulating backend error (500 Internal Server Error, timeout, or network failure)
steps.expectedResult: Backend returns error response to the frontend

steps.action: Observe the application behavior during the failure
steps.expectedResult: Application remains stable without crashes, freezes, or unresponsive states

steps.action: Verify that the user interface continues to be responsive
steps.expectedResult: UI elements remain functional and employee can navigate to other sections

steps.action: Check for any console errors or application crashes
steps.expectedResult: No application crashes occur; error is handled gracefully

steps.action: Attempt to retry the schedule data retrieval
steps.expectedResult: System allows retry attempt without requiring application restart

postconditions: Application remains stable and operational
No crashes or system failures occurred
Employee can continue using other features of the application
Error handling mechanisms are confirmed to be working properly

storyTitle: As Employee, I want the schedule interface to load quickly to avoid delays in accessing my schedule

testCases.title: Validate schedule page load times under normal conditions
preconditions: Employee is logged into the system with valid credentials
Network conditions are normal (stable internet connection)
Backend services are running normally
Browser cache is cleared to simulate first-time load
Performance monitoring tools are configured and ready

steps.action: Start performance timer or monitoring tool
steps.expectedResult: Timer is initiated and ready to measure page load time

steps.action: Employee navigates to the schedule page by clicking on schedule menu or link
steps.expectedResult: Schedule page begins loading and data retrieval is initiated

steps.action: Measure the time taken for the schedule page to fully load and display schedule data
steps.expectedResult: Page loads completely within 3 seconds with all schedule data visible

steps.action: Verify that all schedule elements (dates, shifts, assignments) are rendered correctly
steps.expectedResult: All schedule components are displayed properly without missing data

steps.action: Employee interacts with schedule view by scrolling, clicking on dates, or switching views
steps.expectedResult: No noticeable delays or lag during interactions; UI responds immediately

steps.action: Perform additional navigation within the schedule (e.g., next week, previous week)
steps.expectedResult: Subsequent navigation is smooth and responsive without delays

postconditions: Schedule page is fully loaded and functional
Page load time is recorded and meets the 3-second threshold
Employee can interact with schedule without performance issues
Performance metrics are logged for analysis

testCases.title: Verify backend API response times
preconditions: Backend API endpoints are accessible and operational
API testing tool (e.g., Postman, curl) is configured
Valid authentication tokens are available
Network conditions are normal
Backend services are not under heavy load

steps.action: Prepare API request for schedule data with valid employee credentials and parameters
steps.expectedResult: API request is properly formatted with required headers and authentication

steps.action: Start timer and send schedule data request to backend API endpoint
steps.expectedResult: API request is sent successfully to the backend server

steps.action: Monitor the API response time from request initiation to response receipt
steps.expectedResult: Backend API responds with schedule data

steps.action: Measure and record the total response time
steps.expectedResult: Response is received within 2 seconds of sending the request

steps.action: Verify the response contains complete and valid schedule data
steps.expectedResult: Response payload includes all expected schedule information with correct data structure

steps.action: Repeat the API request 3-5 times to ensure consistent performance
steps.expectedResult: All subsequent requests also respond within 2 seconds consistently

postconditions: Backend API response times are confirmed to meet the 2-second threshold
Schedule data is successfully retrieved
Performance metrics are documented
API performance is consistent across multiple requests

testCases.title: Ensure system handles concurrent users without degradation
preconditions: Load testing tool is configured (e.g., JMeter, LoadRunner)
Multiple test user accounts are available
Backend system is in normal operational state
Performance monitoring is enabled on backend servers
Baseline performance metrics are established

steps.action: Configure load testing tool to simulate 50 concurrent employee users accessing schedule page
steps.expectedResult: Load testing tool is properly configured with user scenarios and timing

steps.action: Start the load test to simulate multiple concurrent employee requests to the schedule system
steps.expectedResult: Load test initiates and begins sending concurrent requests from simulated users

steps.action: Monitor the response times for all concurrent requests during the test
steps.expectedResult: System processes all concurrent requests simultaneously

steps.action: Verify that all requests are processed within the defined performance thresholds (3 seconds for page load, 2 seconds for API)
steps.expectedResult: All requests are completed within performance thresholds without significant degradation

steps.action: Check backend server metrics (CPU, memory, database connections) during concurrent load
steps.expectedResult: Server resources remain within acceptable limits without bottlenecks

steps.action: Review error rates and failed requests during the concurrent load test
steps.expectedResult: Error rate is minimal (less than 1%) and no requests fail due to system overload

steps.action: Gradually increase concurrent users to 100 and repeat monitoring
steps.expectedResult: System continues to handle increased load without performance degradation beyond acceptable thresholds

postconditions: System performance under concurrent load is documented
All concurrent requests were processed successfully
Performance thresholds were maintained under load
System stability is confirmed for multiple concurrent users
Load test results are saved for future reference
